intro: Hieracium kinnense, commonly known as the Kinnis hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal rosettes of lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, and the plant is known for its ability to thrive in rocky and well-drained soils. Hieracium kinnense is also notable for its role in local ecosystems as a food source for various insects and a pioneer species in disturbed habitats.
